reviews.sentence: Old run down dirty and needs complete remodel. This hotel is old dirty run down and needs serious attention. I can not believe it is a Mariot brand. The bathroom was tiny rusty and falling apart. Housekeeping did not even clean our room one day. Very overpriced for what we got. Would NOT recommend this hotel.

We were a family of 4 2 adults and 2 kids when I reserved a room with 2 beds upon arrival they only had a king available they stated all the 2 beds were gone. They sent up a rolaway 1 kid slept on floor they did not offer a discount or even to change us rooms the next day.

Do Not Recomend This Hotel. Huge disappointment in terms of broken in room coffee system poorly functioning shower. NO HOUSEKEEPING service on Christmas Day even though management indicated it would be provided on a limited basis. We expect a high level of customer service from this hotel chain but someone is not paying attention to this property.

Lots of pluses and a few minuses. Pluses the staff especially the young lady who works the coffee bar in the morning such a treat to be greeted cheerfully and sincerely. I was there for my Dads funeral and she comped my coffee after she asked why I was staying. Brought tears to my eyes. And the room service servers are very nice. And speaking of room service it was fast served hot and very good. How I am treated by staff goes a long way. The room was clean comfortable and everything worked. A little used but. oh well it is a hotel and you can not expect Grandmas house. The location is perfect and parking is plentiful. Yes there are concerts nearby but the hotel does give a warning notice. not that it changes anything but at least we knew what to expect and got the ear plugs out. Minuses. I have stayed here several times because it is close to family events but the last time I stayed I got a room by the stairs and the door to the stairwell was very loud WHAM. Especially at 2 in the morning. I am guessing it was staff slipping the bill under the door. so please have them be careful shutting the door. And I had appreciate cardboard drinking cups in the rooms because I am always a little nervous about drinking out of maybe not the cleanest glass. And bath drains need to be cleaned out frequently. there is nothing as horrifying as taking a shower and seeing a mass of hair not your own. floating around your ankles. But overall a good hotel in a great location with a very nice staff.

Tough to leave this property 3 stars because for the most part the people are a 5. Very dated and need of an update. Nice size rooms with smaller bathrooms in need of repair. The Executive Lounge is on of the worst I have seen. I was in before 7 am for breakfast and what little they had watermelon and blueberries bad scrambled eggs and I think sausage. The bread was picked over one piece of marbled bread left and two bagels. The eggs were near the bottom and instead of refreshing she scraped the bottom. Evening is not much better two nights of deep fried somethings one I think was pigs in a blanket. Some veggies crowded on a plate and bags of chips no cheese and crackers which is the staple of most lounges. In the room the bed was comfortable but the shower tub combo would not drain standing in ankle deep water and the iron was broke not a shock. Loud a c that can not be turned off made sleep difficult. exterior ground were not very well maintained either. Wish i could say the location was worth staying here for but it is not maybe if you are going to a convention at the convention center otherwise in a sketchy area with not much around.

The staff are very courteous and helpful. They make the stay overall enjoyable. The hotel is a little dated as seen by the exterior and some interior furnishings. Parking could be better. Having to cross a street to get to the hotel entrance is a safety risk.

Disappointed no microwave in the room and found broccoli inside the refrigerator that was not cleaned out by housekeeping. The quote restaurant was at the bar area and nothing cozy about it. Ordered room service for breakfast and it was cold toast burnt. no condiments as requested and took almost an hour.

Clean and comfortable with great customer service. Customer service was fantastic lobby was clean. My only complaint was room location. Our room was located right next to the side exit and throughout the night our sleep was interrupted due to door opening and closing. Otherwise it ’s a nice hotel near the convention center and youth sporting venues. I would recommend this hotel.

Spring Training Go to Hotel. They have done some nice updates to the room since I was here last year and made the rooms much nicer. I will say there are still some things that they did n’t update like the windows along the walkways the doors on the exterior and the HVAC and showers in the rooms. Upon check in the customer service rep notified me that I would need to call engineering to have them come into the room to switch out HVAC from heat to AC. I ’ve never had that happen in any hotel I ’ve stayed at. He ended up having to open up a panel in the bathroom ceiling to switch it from heat to AC. That system MUST be older. That ’s a bit frustrating if you like to toggle between heat and AC throughout the day as they would need to continue coming back to adjust it. It ’s also pretty loud once it kicks on. There was some sort of a rattle going on. The shower stall also needed some updating. I found that the water tends to pool in the middle and you can clearly see it ’s an older tub. One other thing I noticed is that the hallway to our room was a bit uneven by the ice machine so you have to be careful especially if you are unsteady on your feet. I do wish they had better parking right next to the hotel. Even with all of that said I will probably stay here again next year as it ’s so close to Hohokam Park.
Very comfortable setting and easy parking layout. Check in was easy and the room even came with free water bottles to battle the heat outside.

Great hotel with an amazing staff. Huge shoutout to Amber in the sales department for helping us with our wedding block for all our guests. The hotel is well kept very modern furnishings and in a great location in Mesa. Highly recommend.

Beautiful hotel great location. Room was spacious and beautifully decorated. Our room had a great view of the mountains. Loved the breakfast. Staff was friendly and helpful. Within walking distance of downtown Mesa. There were a lot charging plugs in the room the most I have ever seen in a room.

Pleasant. It is partially remodeled bathrooms are not. The furnishings in the bedroom area were clean comfortable and modern. The air conditioning was not working throughout the hotel. The room was very hot. They moved us to a room on the other side of the hotel and brought a fan which helped. The bathroom had an odd smell coming from the drains old tub that was super slippery. We preset food from their bites menu they did n’t have the soda I requested and forgot to include the sour cream. They ended up comping one night of our stay which made up for the issues.
It was very modern and up to date furnishings and furniture. USB plugs all around plus a desk setup with additional outlets.

I felt like the Alpha Dog at the DELTA. Very laid back place. Quiet and spacious room. Staff was warm and friendly both on the phone and in person. Pillows got at Thumbs Up from myself and my 21 year old daughter. Wished I could have had more time to have utilized the pool. Looked quite clean and inviting.

Adequate for a business stay. Parking is free but poorly designed. Bathrooms are dated and need updating. Tub was slow to drain with shower running. Shower tub also needed a deep clean. Beds were clean and very comfortable. Nice TV with streaming services and good work station in the room.

Hotel is nice Room bathroom was in poor repair. Overall experience was great. Check in was a breeze with helpful staff. Room was clean. Beautiful building and great amenities. The cons. Tub did not drain and you stood in ankle deep water during shower repaired after first night. Bathroom faucet was covered in mineral buildup from leaky faucet which also was leaking on the floor not fixed faucet in the bathroom would also not drain half fixed.
It was clean and the beds were comfortable. It was a great room for the money. Room service was quick and we enjoyed our breakfast.

Over all everything was very nice. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. My only complaint would be the confusions as to whether or not we had access to the concierge services on the top floor. Expedia seemed to say that we did but it only meant that we could take the elevator to the top floor and look at the people using the pantry services. It seemed a really stupid selling point. Thankfully after not budging on what was represented the hotel staff comped the services for our stay there.

Pretty good. Besides the socks the rest of the room was really clean and comfortable. The view was nice and the tv options were good. Best part was how close it was to the convention center. A pair of dirty socks was found hidden behind our towels. We just threw them away.
